Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Loch \Loch\ (l[o^]k), n. [Gael. & Olr. loch. See {Lake} of water.] A lake; a bay or arm of the sea. [Scot.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Loch \Loch\ (l[o^]k), n. [F. looch, Ar. la'[=u]g, an electuary, or any medicine which may be licked or sucked, fr. la'[=u]q to lick.] (Med.) A kind of medicine to be taken by licking with the tongue; a lambative; a lincture. [1913 Webster]
loch n 1: a long narrow inlet of the sea in Scotland (especially when it is nearly landlocked) 2: Scottish word for a lake
